FacilityName: THE SYRACUSE COOP EXCH (SOUTH KENDALL PLT)

_exec_summary.SummaryText: OUR COMPANY STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A SAFE WORKPLACE FOR OUR EMPLOYEES AND THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE.  OUR FARMER OWNERS, MANAGER AND EMPLOYEES HAVE MADE EVERY EFFORT TO PLAN AND PREVENT ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THIS FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND TRANSFER OF ANHYDRONS AMMONIA TO OUR CUSTOMER.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED IS 79,000 LBS.  THE WORS CASE RELEASE SCENERIO WOULD BE THE RELEASE AS A GAS OVER TEN MINUTES.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY RELEASED WOULD BE 79,000 LBS., WHICH REPRESENTS THE VOLUME OF THE STORAGE AT 85 PERCENT CAPACITY AS LIMITED BY DESIGN STANDARDS AND COMPANY POLICY.  THE DISTANCE TO END POINT IN A WORSE CASE SCENERIO OS 1.89 MILES FROM OUR NH3 PLANT.  THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO BASE ON OUR HISTORY AND INDUSTRY INFORMATIONIS A RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A TRANSFER HOSE.  THE DISTANCE TO END POINT IN OUR SITUATION IS .83 MILES.  THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAS CAUSED INJURY OR DEATH OR OFF SITE DEATHS, INJURIES, OR EVACUATION, NOR HAVE WE HAD A RELEASE THAT HAS REQUIRED SHELTERING IN PLACE OR OTHER EMERGENCY PROCEDURES.  THE EMERGENCY PLAN WE HAVE DEVELOPED IN CONJUNCTION WITH OUR SUPPLIERS AND OTHER INDUSTRY EXPERTS IS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE RISKS TO EMPLOYEES, THE PUBLIC, AS WELL AS EMERGENCY RESPONDERS.  WE ARE PROUD OF THE EXCELLANT SAFETY PROGRAM WE HAVE DEVELOPED AS WELL AS OUR SAFETY RECORD.  IT IS OUR DESIRE TO CONTINUE TO IMPROVE OUR EFFORTS AND DEVELOP ADDITIONAL PROCEDURES AND METHODS TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY SERVICE TO OUR CUSTOMERS AND PATRONS IN A SAFE MANNER.
